Q1: Who is Rebecca Smart?
A1: Rebecca Smart is an Australian actress born on January 30, 1976.

Q2: What was Smart's first movie role?
A2: Smart's first movie role was in The Coca-Cola Kid.

Q3: What were some of Smart's early life experiences?
A3: Smart was born in Tamworth, New South Wales and was educated at St Catherine's School, an independent Anglican school for girls in the eastern suburbs of Sydney.

Q4: What awards has Smart won?
A4: Smart won the Most Popular Actress in a Miniseries/Telemovie Silver Logie award for her performance in The Shiralee and was also nominated for Best Supporting Actress at the Australian Film Institute Awards and the Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards for her performance in Blackrock.

Q5: What is Smart's filmography?
A5: Smart has appeared in various films and television shows, including miniseries and soap operas.

Q1: What is the name of the film directed by Dušan Makavejev?
A1: The Coca-Cola Kid

Q2: Who stars in the film as an American marketing executive?
A2: Eric Roberts

Q3: What is the fictional town in Australia where the film takes place?
A3: Anderson Valley

Q4: Why do the locals resist Coca-Cola products?
A4: A local producer of soft drinks run by an old eccentric has been successfully fending off the American brand name products.

Q5: Who is the office manager in the film?
A5: Greta Scacchi

Q6: What is the name of the consultant who helped with the production of the film?
A6: Denny Lawrence

Q7: How much did the film gross at the box office in Australia?
A7: $36,365

Q8: When was the Region 1 DVD of the film released in the United States?
A8: April 16, 2002

Q9: What special features are included on the DVD release of the film?
A9: Theatrical trailer and an interview with Greta Scacchi and David Roe titled "The Real Thing".

Q10: When was the Blu-ray version of the film released in the United States?
A10: June 16, 2022

Q11: What new feature is included on the Blu-ray release of the film?
A11: An interview with Eric Roberts and a new audio commentary.

Q12: Can you name any accolades the film received?
A12: See also Cinema of Australia.

Q13: What is the name of the book written by Frank Moorhouse that the film is based on?
A13: The Americans, Baby.

Q14: How many reviews did Rotten Tomatoes give the film?
A14: 17.

Q15: What rating did Rotten Tomatoes give the film?
A15: 47%.
